headers: LABOR CHAIN v2 — THE REAL SEQUENCE

rows.LABOR CHAIN v2 — THE REAL SEQUENCE: VA finds the people. PM co-founder runs the launch. Actor is the face. Incorporation done right.
THE INSIGHT
The VA was overloaded. Admin + daily video updates + public face + site interface
is four jobs. The daily video person needs to be GOOD ON CAMERA — that's a casting
decision, not an admin hire. And the launch needs a real project manager who treats
this like producing a show, not filing paperwork.
So the chain splits into three distinct hires that the VA sources:
VA → finds PM Co-founder (runs the launch like a cluster production)
VA → finds Actor/Host (the on-camera face, web series energy)
VA → supports incorporation (alongside PM who drives it)
The VA is the recruiter and admin backbone.
The PM co-founder is the brain.
The actor is the face.
THE REVISED CHAIN
Step

rows.col_3: Locks M0. Posts VA job. Provides imagination asset (706 tabs). Sets quality bar.
rows.col_4: Locked thesis. Live VA posting. The system.

rows.col_3: Admin execution + recruiting. Screens candidates for PM co-founder and actor. Manages entity paperwork. Supports CoS pipeline. The recruiter and admin backbone of the sprint.
rows.col_4: PM co-founder hired. Actor hired. Entity paperwork filed. CoS pipeline started. Tool stack set up.
rows.col_5: PM Co-founder. Actor/Host. Supports CoS search.

rows.LABOR CHAIN v2 — THE REAL SEQUENCE: 3a
rows.col_3: The brain. Runs the entire IonWave launch like a cluster production. Owns the timeline. Drives incorporation. Coordinates expert sessions. Manages the site build (works with product person). Manages the actor. This is the person who wakes up every day and moves every piece forward.
rows.col_4: IonWave incorporated correctly. Site live. Expert sessions scheduled and completed. Investor pipeline open. Product person managed. Actor directed. The launch itself.
rows.col_5: Product Person. CoS (for holding company). Experts.

rows.LABOR CHAIN v2 — THE REAL SEQUENCE: 3b
rows.col_3: The face. On-camera talent for daily video updates. Not acting — narrating reality. Cinematic quality. Posts every day. Introduces cast members. Covers milestones. Makes the site alive.
rows.col_4: Daily 60-90 sec videos. Milestone episodes (3-5 min). The content that makes the site work. The personality that makes people want to follow along.
rows.col_5: N/A — their job is content, not recruiting.

rows.LABOR CHAIN v2 — THE REAL SEQUENCE: 3c
rows.col_3: Builds both sites. IonWave DAO spinoff page + infrastructure company page. Sets up CMS so actor can post without code. 2-week sprint.
rows.col_4: Two live sites. CMS configured. Brand system. Password architecture.

rows.col_3: Found by VA pipeline, vetted by PM co-founder, approved by Nilo. Executes IonWave launch as fundraising proof for holding company. Brings capital or capital access.
rows.col_4: IonWave operational. Revenue starting. Holding company fundraise initiated.
rows.col_5: CoS for holding company. Venture Partners.

rows.LABOR CHAIN v2 — THE REAL SEQUENCE: PM CO-FOUNDER — WHY THIS IS THE KEY HIRE
This is not a project manager. This is a co-founder of IonWave who happens to be
a world-class project manager. The distinction matters.
A project manager manages a timeline. A co-founder owns the outcome.
What 'co-founder' means here:
• Equity in IonWave (meaningful, not token — 5-15%)
• Their name on the incorporation documents
• Decision-making authority on the launch (within M0 constraints)
• Accountability to Nilo, but autonomy on execution
What 'PM' means here:
• Runs the 3-week sprint like a production
• Every task has an owner, a deadline, a verification
• Expert sessions are scheduled, prepped, debriefed
• The product person ships on time because someone is managing them
• The actor posts every day because someone is directing them
• The incorporation happens right because someone is driving it
'Launch of a cluster' is exactly the right frame.
The PM co-founder is the Cluster PM for the launch cluster.
The launch IS a cluster: incorporation, site, content, experts, fundraising.
Each of those is a workstream. The PM co-founder coordinates them all.
ACTOR / HOST — CASTING SPEC
This is a casting decision, not a hiring decision.
What they need:
• Camera presence (you want to watch them, not just tolerate them)
• Attractive (not model — but someone the camera loves)
• Articulate without being scripted (can explain things clearly while sounding natural)
• Consistent energy (Day 1 energy and Day 21 energy should feel the same)
• Curious (genuinely interested in what's happening, asks good questions in milestone interviews)
• Comfortable with daily production (this is a rhythm, not a performance)
Where to find them:
• Acting students / recent grads who want reel material
• YouTube/TikTok creators who want to be part of something bigger
• Journalist/host types who are between gigs
• 'Part of a new web series' is the pitch — it IS a web series
Compensation:
• Small daily rate ($50-100/day for 30 min of work) OR
• Flat fee for 3-week run ($500-1500) OR
• Equity + rate (if they're exceptional and want to stay)
• Reel material: 21+ days of produced content for their portfolio
The pitch to the actor:
'We're building a company in real time and documenting every day as a web series.
You're the host. 60-90 seconds per day, cinematic quality, real story.
21 days minimum. If the project succeeds, this becomes an ongoing role.
Your face is the brand. We make you look amazing.'
